input_text:
Job Title: Sr Developer

Location: Morrisville, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Product Management, Science

Description:
Showcase your talents with PPD, a part of Thermo Fisher Scientific, where you can apply your creativity, experience and technical expertise to impact lives and patient outcomes. Our PPD Enterprise Data team is at the center of all data flows, assets to inform data science, advanced analytics, data sharing, data engineering and robust APIs. Your career with us can span and evolve across all of these in a highly collaborative, forward-looking setting.

The Enterprise Data Group (E-Data) owns our data, the cloud, and data analytics. This team within E-Data manages development, architecture and design for integration projects. We are seeking a Senior Systems Developer to work with key stakeholders and technical teams to build system solutions. This is a great opportunity in an integral department of our organization.

Essential Functions:

Designs and develops components and services according to specifications within a team environment.Prepares detailed system documentation including requirements, specifications, test plans and user manuals.Performs unit, system and validation testing as required.Collaborates with business systems analysts, business partners and sponsors to understand requirements.Works with Architect on solution design.Coordinates application deployments with Operations staff.Works with business partners and sponsors to analyze and address support and training requests during and after deployment.Contributes to system development standards and process improvements.Serves as a knowledge source for the E-Data group on systems development.Provides guidance to peers and junior staff members in executing systems development responsibilities.Ensures all activities are performed with quality and compliance.Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.8+ years of experience that provides the knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the job.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Excellent knowledge of SQL, Snowflake, Azure Dev Ops and GITExperience with Talend ETL toolsExperience with API tools, Oracle SOA or MulesoftExpert knowledge of basic relational database platforms (Oracle, SQL Server) and languages (PL/SQL, SQL)Experience with PythonExpert knowledge of Data Warehouse platforms (Snowflake preferred)Strong experience in Data Security StandardsExcellent documentation skillsClient focused approach with strong interpersonal skillsMust be able to multitask and pay close attention to detailStrong logic, analysis, and problem-solving skillsStrong communication skills, with all levels of the organizationExperience in a Clinical Research Organization (CRO) preferred.Knowledge of Clinical Regulatory Standards and Computer System Validation preferred.

Working Environment:

PPD values the health and wellbeing of our employees. We support and encourage individuals to create a healthy and balanced environment where they can thrive. Below is listed the working environment/requirements for this role:

Able to communicate, receive, and understand information and ideas with diverse groups of people in a comprehensible and reasonable manner. Able to work upright and stationary for typical working hours. Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology with proficiency. Able to perform successfully under pressure while prioritizing and handling multiple projects or activities.

Our 4i Values:

Integrity – Innovation – Intensity – Involvement

If you resonate with our 4i values above, we’d love to hear from you!

Diversity Statement

PPD is proud to be an affirmative action employer that values diversity as a strength and fosters an environment of mutual respect. PPD is committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, pregnancy, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status or status within any other protected group.

Experience Level (if available): None

Prepares detailed system documentation including requirements, specifications, test plans, and user manuals.
Performs unit, system, and validation testing as required.
Collaborates with business systems analysts, business partners, and sponsors to understand requirements.
Works with Architect on solution design.
Coordinates application deployments with Operations staff.
Works with business partners and sponsors to analyze and address support and training requests during and after deployment.
Contributes to system development standards and process improvements.
Serves as a knowledge source for the E-Data group on systems development.
Provides guidance to peers and junior staff members in executing systems development responsibilities.
Ensures all activities are performed with quality and compliance.

Able to perform successfully under pressure while prioritizing and handling multiple projects or activities.
